@LiamoJC @Laconic_doc There was a great blog recently - a really honest account of a docs struggles with the challenges of work, planned suicide but stopped by the intervention of vigilant colleagues. We have to support one another #irishmed

@Laconic_doc Really important #irishmed
@drlfarrell and maybe communities? It takes a village to keep a village well? #irishmed
T5: Adequate staffing and environment, training and development and an open culture #irishmed
@Laconic_doc @22Q11_Ireland @khanlon @drlfarrell Me too! #irishmed
@Laconic_doc or @drkathrynmannix book #irishmed
@ValTwomey Yes! Really important and removes or a least eases a huge burden of navigation
t4: By co-designing the treatment plan honestly and realistically #irishmed
@LiamoJC or allow them to choose suitable slots? #irishmed
@MaynoothNest I think each are very applicable to the real world with the right tools and practice! #irishmed
T3: Reduction of variation, co-design and real time feedback #irishmed
@mancunianmedic @NVTweeting Irish version here @ipposi https://t.co/QzxGZg4y2u #irishmed
T2: by involving them in the design and delivery of interventions and getting real time feedback about stuff that matters #irishmed
yes. So when designing an intervention or study - if co-designed the right questions of tools can be designed? #irishmed
I think it reflects our obsession with standardised tools for things that perhaps can't be standardised? Perhaps there are better tools or questions? #irishmed
I agree
T1: Although there are many tools I think at the end of the day it means the things that matter to an individual #irishmed
No better man for the lurking and the learning! #irishmed
